snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s administration says the ads are a valuable tool for recruiting businesses, but critics say they are a backdoor way of elevating the governor’s stature.
abstract: Cuomo administration has set aside nearly $140 million for advertising campaign called New York State Open for Business, with money drawn largely from state authority created to lower electricity bills and from federal disaster aid; administration says ads are valuable tool for recruiting businesses, but critics say they are backdoor way of elevating the governor’s stature.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s administration says the ads are a valuable tool for recruiting businesses, but critics say they are a backdoor way of elevating the governor’s stature.

headline.seo: Ad Campaign Selling State to Businesses Is Criticized
headline.main: Ad Effort Selling State as a Business Haven Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Ad Effort Selling State as a Business Haven Is Criticized
